instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02016: What is 820-02016? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Power
threads.message:
Hello,

I have a MacBook Air that does not want to turn on. Plugging in a known good charger shows a blank amp meter screen when typically we see 5v or 20v. I replaced the type C charging ports and replaced the <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>'s to quickly rule them out. I have a schematic, but I don't have a board view.

The fuse and the 3 caps near each type C chips have no voltage and from previous boards I've worked on these are supposed to be the 20V vbus and the 3.3v RTC and LDO for the two type C chips. The power seems to be missing very early on in the power sequence. Any advice and anyone with a link to a board view?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Power
threads.message: Check diode mode to ground on CC1/2 lines.
